text: Paignton Zoo is a zoo located in Devon, England. It was opened in 1923. File:Orangutan in Paignton Zoo.jpg|Orangutan File:Elephant.pair.750pix.jpg|Elephants Duchess (left) and Gay (right). Gay was put to sleep in 2010 File:Kafue lechwe - Paignton Zoo 2010-03-14.jpg|Lechwe File:Giraffa camelopardalis rothschildi.jpg|Giraffe File:Paignton , Paignton Zoo, Elephant House - geograph.org.uk - 1484850.jpg|Duchess, taken after Gay's death == West part of zoo == The West Part of Paignton Zoo includes flamingos, ducks, cranes, blind cave fish, pittas, geckos, budgerigars, guinea pigs, spider monkeys, echidnas and lesser adjaunt storks. == North part of zoo == The North of the Zoo consists mainly of a crocodile house, birds, kangaroos, tortoises, camels and zebras. == East part of zoo == The East of Paignton Zoo holds elephants, giraffes, maned wolves, mandrill, cheetahs, rhinoceroses and coatis. == South part of zoo == The South consists of lions, tigers, an off-show kiwi, parrots, and other aviaries. Category:1923 establishments in England Category:Zoos in the United Kingdom Category:Buildings and structures in Devon
title: Paignton Zoo
